phrases.text: Hơ hơ hơ hơ ơ hơi ha hơ hơ hơ hư ha hô hô hô

culturalContext.description: The exclamatory form adds emotional emphasis, common in Vietnamese folk music to engage listeners. Work songs from Central and Southern Vietnam, sung during communal labor.
facts: Hò songs helped coordinate physical labor like rowing boats or pounding rice
Often featured call-and-response between workers to maintain rhythm
Vietnamese folk songs preserve oral traditions passed down through generations without written notation
Dan Tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are relatively modern adaptations of vocal traditions
culturalContext.musicalContext: This exclamatory phrase contains 15 syllables, longer than typical, allowing for extended melodic development. As an exclamatory phrase, it likely features sustained notes or ascending contours for emotional expression. Strong rhythmic foundation matching physical work movements.
